channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Stretch your summer at Florida’s best spas and wellness escapes
item.description: Labor Day may mark the unofficial end of summer, but in Florida, the heat and the chance for indulgence between hurricanes linger long after the last backyard barbecue. For those not ready to trade flip-flops for fall, the state’s top spas and wellness spaces offer one more excuse to savor summer.

item.title: What to know about rider safety after man died on Florida coaster
item.description: The investigation into the death of aKissimmee man whodied from accidental injuries he suffered whileriding on Stardust Racers at Epic Universeis still underway.

item.title: Popular national burger restaurant chain to make Sarasota area debut
item.description: Afterpreviously revealing plans for a Sarasota location, a popular national fast-food burger chain now has a new area restaurant confirmed to be in the works, as part of a major new development in Bradenton.

item.title: Auburn men's basketball coach Bruce Pearl leaving job after 11 seasons
item.description: Auburnmen's basketball coach Bruce Pearlis stepping down as head coachand will be replaced by his son, Steven, the school announced Monday, Sept. 22.

item.title: Vote for the Herald-Tribune Girls Athlete of the Week for Sept. 15-20
item.description: Each week The Herald-Tribune staff will select nominees for the Herald-Tribune Girls Athlete of the Week poll sponsored by Central Florida Behavioral Network, Inc. Nominees are derived from scores and stats emailed in by Sarasota and Manatee county coaches during the week tohtincoming@gmail.com. Readers can then vote in the online poll to determine the Girls Athlete of the Week.

item.title: Charlie Kirk funeral: List of Trump family members who attended
item.description: PresidentDonald Trumpspoke at Charlie Kirk’s funeral − withsome of his biggest supportersby his side.

item.title: Vote for the Herald-Tribune Boys Athlete of the Week for…
item.description: Each week The Herald-Tribune staff will select nominees for the Herald-Tribune Boys Athlete of the Week poll sponsored by Central Florida Behavioral Network, Inc. Nominees are derived from scores and stats emailed in by Sarasota and Manatee county coaches during the week tohtincoming@gmail.com. Readers can then vote in the online poll to determine the Boys Athlete of the Week.

item.title: Sarasota County School Board changes the time on next…
item.description: The Sarasota County School Board voted earlier this month to change its meeting times through the end of the year from 6 p.m. to 10 a.m.

item.title: Who is eligible for clinical trial of drug to reduce…
item.description: Sarasota Memorial Hospitalis enrolling eligible patients in a clinical trial of an investigational drug that could reduce heart attacks and mortality in individuals with a specific genetic variant following a sudden cardiac event.

item.title: Making the grade: Latest Florida bar exam results are in…
item.description: TheUniversity of FloridaandJacksonville Universitywere the only schools to have graduates score over 90 percent on July's bar examination, according toresults releasedSept. 22.

item.title: 'Dancing with the Stars' season 2, week 2. See the theme…
item.description: ABC's hit reality dancing competition show"Dancing with the Stars" returned last weekto celebrate its 20th anniversary and its 34th season, with 14 contestants and their pro partners dancing to their "personal anthem."

item.title: Heres's the latest on 66-unit affordable apartment in North Port
item.description: NORTH PORT – McDowell Housing Partners announced Sept. 17 that it has closed on the financing needed tobegin construction on Ekos at Arbor Park Phase II, a 66-unit affordable housing complex in North Port.

item.title: New College of Florida should reconsider Charlie Kirk statue
item.description: I read about a proposal to install astatue of the late Charlie Kirk at New College of Florida.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel returning to air after Charlie Kirk comments, Disney says
item.description: "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" is returning to TV, less than a week after the Walt Disney Company announced it had pulledJimmy Kimmel's late-night show off the air due to controversial comments about the death of Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Mosaic Co. aims to inject fertilizer production wastewater underground
item.description: The Mosaic Companyaims to inject wastewater contaminated during fertilizer mining and processing deep underground in Polk County, and the Florida Department of Environmental Protection has already granted the first permits necessary to make the effort a reality.
